qas.question: What is the primary sidearm used by the U.S. Army?

The M18 is a type of what kind of grenade?

plausible_answers.text: M16 rifle, the M4 carbine, as well as the 7.62×51mm variant of the FN SCAR

qas.question: What are the most common weapons used by the Navy?

context: The army employs various individual weapons to provide light firepower at short ranges. The most common weapons used by the army are the compact variant of the <b8_0>M16 rifle, the M4 carbine, as well as the 7.62×51mm variant of the FN SCAR<b8_0/> for Army Rangers. The primary sidearm in the U.S. Army is the <a0_0><b4_0>9 mm M9 pistol<b4_0/><a0_0/>; the M11 pistol is also used. Both handguns are to be replaced through the <a3_0><b7_0>Modular Handgun System<a3_0/> program<b7_0/>. Soldiers are also equiped with various hand grenades, such as the <a1_0><b5_0>M67<b5_0/><a1_0/> fragmentation grenade and M18 <a2_0><b6_0>smoke<b6_0/><a2_0/> grenade.
